School_E Admissions

[REJECT]
conversation.thought: Student_E is last on our true priority list, and we still have a chance (however small) to attract a higher-priority student A–D if they become rejected elsewhere and pivot. Given the market structure and identical school priorities, A–D are likely to be absorbed by their higher-ranked choices, but not guaranteed by Round 12. Our objective is to match as high as possible on the true priority list within quota 1, and we prefer an empty seat to taking someone not on the list (E is on the list, but lowest). With no other applicants in our inbox this round and no commitment yet, the optimal strategy to maximize priority is to continue holding for A–D rather than accept E now, despite the risk of ending unfilled.

conversation.message:
Dear School_E Admissions,

I’m applying again in Round 13. School_E remains my clear first choice, and if you extend an offer to me at any point this round, I will accept immediately and commit to enrolling.

Since School_E is the only school still unmatched, I want to reiterate that I can finalize the match right away so you can secure a committed student and close out the process without risking the seat going unfilled.

Thank you for your consideration,
Student_E

[APPLY]
conversation.thought: Only School_E remains unmatched and it is my top true preference. Prior rejections indicate they are holding out for higher-priority students (A–D), but at Round 13 with no other schools left, I should continue applying and explicitly emphasize immediacy/certainty: I will accept instantly, can complete enrollment immediately, and they avoid the risk of ending unmatched. Keep it concise and commitment-focused.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your continued interest and persistence. Given where the market stands in Round 13 and our desire to secure a committed student for our single available seat, we are pleased to offer you admission to School_E.

We appreciate your clear commitment to enroll if accepted, and we look forward to welcoming you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and remain unmatched through Round 13. Our true priority list ranks A–D above E, but none of A–D have ever contacted School_E, and given their preferences (each ranks School_E last), it is extremely unlikely they will apply unless rejected everywhere else. Student_E ranks School_E first and has repeatedly committed to enroll immediately, making acceptance certain and eliminating the risk of ending unfilled. With only School_E unmatched, the market appears stabilized; holding out longer has low expected benefit and high risk. Therefore accept Student_E now to secure a match.
